{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.19826v1", "title": "Components and realizability of fusion systems", "summary": "For $p=2$ it is known that a saturated fusion system is realizable if and
only if each of its components is realizable by a finite quasisimple group. For
odd primes $p$ this is false. Building on work of Broto, M{\o}ller, Oliver, and
Ruiz, we show however that a fusion system $\mathcal{F}$ is realizable if and
only if for each of its components $\mathcal{C}$ there exists a realizable
subnormal subsystem $\mathcal{E}$ of $\mathcal{F}$ with
$O^{p^\prime}(\mathcal{E})=\mathcal{C}$.", "main_category": "math.GR", "categories": "math.GR", "published": "2025-04-28T14:26:21Z"}
